header.#text: Determination of extent of taxpayer compliance in reporting on foreign accounts

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Treasury Inspector General
			 for Tax Administration

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

conduct an analysis designed to measure the extent to which taxpayers are reporting existing
			 foreign accounts and circumventing the 2003 Offshore Voluntary Compliance
			 Initiative, 2009 Offshore Voluntary Disclosure Program, 2011 Offshore
			 Voluntary Disclosure Initiative, and 2012 Offshore Voluntary Disclosure
			 Programs and the extent to which taxpayers are properly utilizing offshore
			 voluntary disclosure initiatives, and
submit a report to
The report required by paragraph (1) shall—

specify the extent to which taxpayers are circumventing offshore voluntary compliance initiatives
			 and the amount of lost revenue as a result of such circumvention, and

header.#text: Increase in educational outreach concerning taxpayer offshore tax obligations

text.#text: The

improve targeting taxpayers with offshore accounts by determining how taxpayers learned about the

use data gained from offshore programs—
to identify taxpayers with unreported foreign accounts, and

to educate populations of taxpayers that might not be aware of their tax obligations related to

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Federal Acquisition
			 Regulation shall be revised to clarify the provisions relating to the use
			 of reverse auctions by Federal agencies.

The revisions to the Federal Acquisition Regulation shall include guidelines for the most efficient
			 use of reverse auctions, including guidelines for ensuring that reverse
			 auctions uphold high quality standards and that small businesses can
			 continue to participate in the procurement process.

term.#tail:
, with respect to a procurement by a Federal agency, means a real-time auction conducted through an
			 electronic medium by a group of offerors that compete against each other
			 by submitting bids for a contract or a task or delivery order, with the
			 ability to submit revised bids throughout the course of the auction, with
			 award made to the offeror that submits the lowest bid.

text.#text: In this section, the term

header.#text: Coin inventory management plan and report

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall develop and implement a plan to reduce
			 spending on coin inventory management.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Board of Governors of the
			 Federal Reserve System

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
The plan required under subsection (a) shall—
assess factors that have increased coin management costs;

establish a process to separately monitor direct and indirect costs, including support costs, of
			 coin management;
establish goals and performance metrics related to coin management costs; and
establish a process to systematically track, analyze, and revise forecasting models of coin orders.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on the plan that includes—

text.#text: The
a timeline for implementing each objective of the plan;
a description of the accuracy of monthly forecasts of coin orders; and
a description of cost effective coin management practices across Federal reserve banks.
